static class FileUtil.Batch_fileFilter
          Filter to find 'batch_' files, will match yyyy(batch_)XXXX.xml it centralCity_batch_ingest.xml or centralCity_batch_overlay.xml and without the remote file suffix

          Filter to find 'batch_' files, will match yyyy(batch_)XXXX_REMOTE.(xml or zip) ie centralCity_batch_ingest_bagit.zip or centralCity_batch_overlay.xml

          look for an xml file WITHOUT 'remote_' marker showing that it was created by a remote ingest.

getDateTimeMilliSecondFileName

public static java.lang.String getDateTimeMilliSecondFileName()
Return a string containing the current date and time to the second of type april-30-2008:093301 that can be used for a file name.

NOTE: ONLY ONE UNIQUE FILE NAME PER MILLISECOND!

Returns:
a string of type april-30-2008:0933
See Also:
getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique()

deleteDirectoryTree

java.io.IOException

getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique

public static java.lang.String getDateTimeMilliSecondEnsureUnique()
Return a string containing the current date and time to the second of type april-30-2008:093301 that can be used for a file name. If the file already exists keep trying until the file name is unique up to MAX_TRIES. This routine therefore can only return one file name per java millisecond at best.

Returns:
String with current/unique date and time to the millisecond
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException
See Also:
MAX_TRIES

getMillisAsString

public static java.lang.String getMillisAsString()
Return a unique number string. The string is based on current millisecond time and will be 13 digits.

Returns:
unique 13 digit string.

getUniqueNumber

public static java.lang.String getUniqueNumber()
Return a unique number string, based on current time in milliseconds.
NOTE: If this routine is called quicker then the java millisecond time changes the number will not be unique!

Returns:
unique 13 digit string.
See Also:
getMillisAsString()

getBatchUniqueFileName

public static java.lang.String getBatchUniqueFileName(java.lang.String originalFileName)
Gets a unique file name, based on the fileName with the time in milliseconds added, also check that the file name contains a BATCH_FILE_IDENTIFIER, if it does not prepend one. This works with .xml and .zip batch files.

Parameters:
originalFileName - ( batch file, with a .xml suffix)
Returns:
a unique file name based on current time.
See Also:
FedoraAppConstants.BATCH_FILE_IDENTIFIER
